name: VillagerInventory
description: The VillagerInventory class provides specialized access to Minecraft's villager trading interface, allowing scripts to interact with villager trades, experience systems, and merchant mechanics.

methods.name: selectTrade
methods.description: Selects the trade offer at the specified index.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the trade to select.

methods.name: getTrades
methods.description: Retrieves a list of all trade offers available from the villager.

methods.name: getExperience
methods.description: Gets the current experience points of the villager.

methods.name: getLevelProgress
methods.description: Gets the villager's current level progress percentage.

methods.name: getMerchantRewardedExperience
methods.description: Gets the amount of experience rewarded to the merchant.

methods.name: canRefreshTrades
methods.description: Checks if the villager can refresh their trades (e.g., after sleeping or working).
examples:
const canRefresh = inv.canRefreshTrades();
Chat.log(`Can Refresh Trades: ${canRefresh ? "Yes" : "No"}`);

methods.name: isLeveled
methods.description: Checks if the villager is leveled or capable of leveling up.
